alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 8:11AM CST until January 27 at 8:34PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River near Cuero. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flooding extends into floodplain above Cuero threatening livestock. US Hwy 183 North at Hochheim has water on or crossing the roadway. Highway likely closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 24.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM CST Thursday was 24.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to rise and crest at 27.4 feet tonight. It will then fall below flood stage midday Saturday. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Guadalupe River Cuero 24.0 24.9 Thu 7 am CST 27.0 23.9 16.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM CST.
